FuncDef:
The ppp timer negotiate command sets a timeout period for PPP negotiation.
The undo ppp timer negotiate command restores the default timeout period of PPP negotiation.
By default, the timeout period of PPP negotiation is 3 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a timeout period.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
PPP is a link layer protocol used to transmit data over P2P links. PPP supports MRU negotiation. If the two ends of a PPP link are configured with the MTUs, you must enable PPP MRU negotiation for the two ends to negotiate the MTU and then exchange data.
Running the ppp timer negotiate command sets a timeout period of PPP negotiation. If PPP fails to receive a reply packet within the configured timeout period, it resends the packet.
Prerequisites
PPP has been configured as the link layer protocol of the interface.
Configuration Impact
If the ppp timer negotiate command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. After the configuration, the timeout period of PPP negotiation changes.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
After the configuration, you must run the shutdown, commit, and undo shutdown commands in the corresponding interface view for the configuration to take effect.
